## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm curious about the Verus DeFi protocol and how it addresses some of the problems in decentralized finance. Can you tell me more about that, and what features it offers for launching new blockchains and currencies?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol is designed to tackle some of the pressing issues in decentralized finance, such as miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running. To address these problems, the protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This approach provides several benefits, including fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, which helps to ensure smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities.

In addition to its DeFi features, the Verus protocol also offers a range of tools and features for launching new blockchains and currencies. For instance, it allows for the simultaneous launch of a new blockchain and a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain and runs on the new blockchain, with all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool earned on the new blockchain.

The Verus protocol also provides features for crowdfunding currency launches, including the ability to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in preferred currencies on chain. If the minimum levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, and price-neutral carve-outs.

Overall, the Verus DeFi protocol offers a number of innovative features and tools for launching and operating decentralized finance applications, including new blockchains and currencies. Its simultaneous blockchain and liquidity pool launches, as well as its crowdfunding currency launch features, make it an attractive option for developers and users looking to create and participate in decentralized finance applications.

## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees.
